intro: Basanacantha portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests, often along stream banks or in rocky crevices. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and the leaves are usually lance-shaped with a waxy texture. Basanacantha portoricensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
